metadata.title: CVE-2021-28090 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Tor before 0.4.5.7 allows a remote attacker to cause Tor directoryauthorities to exit with an assertion failure, aka TROVE-2021-002.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tor - 0.4.6.10-1
tor-geoipdb - 0.4.6.10-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tor package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.6.10-1').
